parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject experienced any healthcare encounters. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not there were any healthcare encounters.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification if all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
fields.label: Any Healthcare Encounters
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: HOYN
fields.questionText: Were there any healthcare encounters?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOCAT

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. Examples include HOSPITALIZATION and OUTPATIENT.
fields.label: Category for Healthcare Encounter
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: HOCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the healthcare encounter?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the HOCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. HOSCAT can only be used if there is an HOCAT and it must be a subcategorization of HOCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Healthcare Encounter
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: HOSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the healthcare encounter?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOOCCUR

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if [specific healthcare encounter/event topic] has occurred/is occurring by checking Yes or No.
fields.definition: An indication whether a health encounter occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
fields.implementationNotes: The CDASH variable HOOCCUR is used is used to report the occurrence of a prespecified healthcare encounter. HOOCCUR is not used if the healthcare encounters are collected on the CRF in a manner that requires a free-flow text response. The site should be able to indicate in a separate item (or system variable) that the question was not asked or answered.
fields.label: Healthcare Encounter Occurrence
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: HOOCCUR
fields.questionText: Did the subject have [prespecified healthcare encounter term]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOPRESP

fields.definition: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are prespecified on a CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: A hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM-based dataset creation, when the healthcare encounter is prespecified. Null for spontaneously reported events. If a study collects both prespecified healthcare encounters as well as free-text events, the value of HOPRESP should be "Y" for all prespecified events and null for events reported as free-text. HOPRESP is a permissible field in SDTM and may be omitted from the SDTM-based dataset if all events were collected as free text.
fields.label: prespecified Healthcare Encounter
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: HOPRESP

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOREASND

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason why the subject's Healthcare Encounters experience was not assessed.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (e.g., subject not asked) or entered as free text. When HOREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable HOSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: Reason Healthcare Encounter Not Done
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: HOREASND
fields.questionText: What was the reason the data was not collected?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOSPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
fields.implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: HO Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: HOSPID
fields.questionText: [Sponsor defined question]

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOTERM

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reported Term for the Healthcare Encounter

fields.completionInstructions: Record the healthcare encounter or if used with a HODECOD list, "Other" specify.
fields.definition: The reported or prespecified name of the healthcare encounter.
fields.implementationNotes: If collected on the CRF, sponsors must use either HODECOD or HOTERM and in some cases, both may be used. If the CRF is collecting healthcare encounters using a standardized sponsor-defined code list (e.g., INPATIENT ER, ICU, SURGERY, GENERAL WARD, PROVIDER OFFICE - PRIVATE, PROVIDER OFFICE - HOSPITAL, GASTROENTEROLOGIST), then HODECOD may be used to store the code list response. If the CRF collects "Specify, Other" or similar additional free text descriptions of code list items, then HOTERM may be used to store the detailed descriptive text. If HOTERM is entered only as free text, HODECOD would be populated through the sponsor's coding process.
fields.label: Reported Term for Healthcare Encounter
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: HOTERM
fields.questionText: What was the healthcare encounter?; If [HODECOD], specify

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Healthcare Encounter Dictionary or Standardized Term

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HODECOD

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Dictionary-Derived Term for the Healthcare Encounter

fields.definition: The sponsor-defined standardized text description of HOTERM or the modified topic variable (HOMODIFY), if applicable.
fields.implementationNotes: If collected on the CRF, sponsors must use either HODECOD or HOTERM and in some cases, both may be used. If the CRF is collecting healthcare encounters using a standardized sponsor defined code list (e.g., INPATIENT ER, ICU, SURGERY, GENERAL WARD, PROVIDER OFFICE-PRIVATE, PROVIDER OFFICE-HOSPITAL, GASTROENTEROLOGIST), then HODECOD may be used to store the code list response. If the CRF collects "Specify, Other" or similar additional free text descriptions of code list items, then HOTERM may be used to store the detailed descriptive text. If HOTERM is entered only as free text, HODECOD would be populated through the sponsor's coding process.
fields.label: HO Standardized Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: HODECOD
fields.questionText: What was the (standardized) healthcare encounter (term/code)?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOSTDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start date of the healthcare encounter (e.g., date of admission) using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The start date the healthcare encounter, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The preferred method is to collect a complete Start Date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only, month and year only) may be acceptable.
fields.label: Healthcare Encounter Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable HOSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: HOSTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM] [start/admission] date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOSTTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start time (as complete as possible ) of the healthcare encounter in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.definition: The start time of the healthcare encounter, (e.g., time of admission) represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.label: Healthcare Encounter Start Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable HOSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: HOSTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM] [start/admission] time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOENDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the end date of the healthcare encounter using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The end date of the healthcare encounter, (date of discharge) represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The preferred method is to collect a complete end date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only, month and year only) may be acceptable.
fields.label: Healthcare Encounter End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable HOENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: HOENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM] [end/discharge] date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOENTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the end time (as complete as possible) of the healthcare encounter in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.definition: The end time of the healthcare encounter, (date of discharge) represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.label: Healthcare Encounter End Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable HOENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: HOENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM] [end/discharge] time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOCDUR

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the duration of the healthcare encounter.
fields.definition: Collected duration of the healthcare encounter.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected duration of the healthcare encounter. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from the start and end date/times.
fields.label: Healthcare Encounter Collected Duration
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, concatenate the CDASH collected duration and collected duration unit and populate the SDTMIG variable HODUR in ISO 8601 Period format. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).
fields.name: HOCDUR
fields.questionText: What was the duration of the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOCDURU

fields.completionInstructions: Select the appropriate duration unit of the healthcare encounter.
fields.definition: Unit of the collected duration of the healthcare encounter. Used only if duration was collected on the CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: To ensure data quality, it is recommended that the appropriate duration unit(s) be preprinted on the (e)CRF. If only one unit is appropriate, no data entry would be required.
fields.label: HO Collected Duration Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM-based dataset, concatenate the CDASH collected duration and collected duration unit and populate the SDTMIG variable HODUR in ISO 8601 Period format. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).
fields.name: HOCDURU
fields.questionText: What was the duration unit of the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOONGO

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

fields.completionInstructions: Record the healthcare encounter as ongoing ('Y') if it has not stopped at[at the timepoint defined by the study].
fields.definition: Indication that the encounter is ongoing when no end date is provided.
fields.implementationNotes: Completed to indicate that the healthcare encounter has not ended at the time of data collection. It is expected that every reported encounter has either an End Date or the Ongoing field is populated, but not both. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring; this field provides further confirmation that the End Date was deliberately left blank. Often used as a tick/checkbox. See Section 3.7, Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions, and SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.4.7 for more information.
fields.label: Ongoing Healthcare Encounter
fields.mappingInstructions:
This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as HOENRF or HOENRTPT. When populating HOENRF, if the value of HOONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating HOENRTPT, if the value of HOONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When HOONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTMIG variable HOENRF should be populated. When HOONGO is compared to any other time point, the SDTMIG variables HOENRTPT and HOENTPT should be used. 
 Note: HOENRTPT must refer to a time point anchor described in HOENTPT.
fields.name: HOONGO
fields.prompt: Ongoing as of the[study-specific timepoint or period]
fields.questionText: Was the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM] ongoing(as of the[study-specific timepoint or period?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

priorVersion.title: Reason for the Healthcare Encounter Event

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOREAS

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason for the subject's Healthcare Encounters.
fields.definition: Denotes the reason for the healthcare encounter.
fields.implementationNotes: To ensure data quality, it is recommended that the sponsor develop controlled terminology (e.g., LACK OF EFFICACY, ADVERSE EVENT, CHEMOTHERAPY, PHYSICAL THERAPY, INDICATION UNDER STUDY, NOT INDICATION UNDER STUDY). The sponsor may, however choose to collect this as free text or as a combination of preprinted options and free text in the form of "Specify, Other".
fields.label: Reason for the Healthcare Encounter
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPHO dataset as the value of SUPPHO_QVAL where SUPPHO.QNAM ="HOREAS" and SUPPHO.QLABEL="Healthcare Encounter Reason". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: HOREAS
fields.questionText: What was the reason for the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field HO.HOAENO

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the adverse event that precipitated this encounter.
fields.definition: Identifier for the adverse event that precipitated this encounter.
fields.implementationNotes: Intent is to establish a link between the healthcare encounter record and the AE that was the primary cause of the encounter. HOAENO can be used in RELREC to identify a relationship between records in HO dataset and records in the AE dataset. Other identifiers needed to create RELREC such as HOMHNO can be created as needed. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 8.2 for information on RELREC.
fields.label: Related Adverse Event ID
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the Adverse Events domain.
fields.name: HOAENO
fields.questionText: What was the identifier for the adverse event(s), which precipitated the [healthcare encounter/HOTERM]?
